job.title: Software Engineer
job.description: Proto AI is actively seeking Software Engineers to join its growing Engineering department to work on its growing software development needs. Proto AI provides enterprise-scale AI solutions through software-as-a-service applications in several verticals.Responsibilities:Effectively design, develop, and operate software systems at scaleAssist in the design & architecture for new productsAbility to convert applied mathematics to computational engineeringExcellent written and oral communication skillsDevelop and maintain unit and integration testsWorking with Microsoft Azure to deploy highly available, scalable, and secure applicationsWork efficiently and meet project deadlines with limited supervisionParticipate as a team member in sprint demonstrations and presentations to product stakeholdersStrong attention to detail, critical thinking skills, and solid troubleshooting abilityCreate the functional design & architecture for new products & featuresMaintain control of source, research and trade secretsConvert applied mathematics to computational engineeringQualifications: Self-starter who needs minimal supervision, is curious about software, and comes with a team-first approach to the positionEnjoys a start-up atmosphere and is flexible, shows good judgement, takes initiative, and is willing to take on a variety of tasks and responsibilities as needed to achieve goalsA 4-yr college degree in Computer Science or a related fieldAt least 5 years software development experience, preferably with C# and C++3 years of experience building web, microservice solutions in Windows/Linux environments2+ years of experience building and deploying scalable, and secure enterprise solutions with Azure or AWSUnderstanding of Microservices design, development, and deployment on Azure Service FabricExperience with DevOps practices for CI/CD, release management, and automation using Azure DevOpsPluses:Familiarity with developing software to support parallel computingFamiliarity with Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, and Durability (ACID) rulesUnderstanding of inter-process communication to include custom marshaling and threading scenarios
